subject: Re: Difference running junit in ant compared to Eclipse
msgSnippet: ... test ... CODE SNIPPET ( in class CarrierMoImplTest) ========== public static Test suite() { TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(THIS_CLASS); TestSetup setup =
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, "Lasse Koskela" <lasse.koskela@...> wrote:
>
> Hi Mikael,
>
> On 07 Mar 2007 04:47:45 -0800, eraonel eraonel@... wrote:
> > I execute a Junit test in Eclipse fine. Then when I run the same
test
> > in Ant I get a NullPointerException.
> > Have anyone experienced the same problem?
>
> A stack trace of the NullPointerException plus a code snippet around
> where the NPE is thrown would help us help you.

CODE SNIPPET ( in class CarrierMoImplTest)
==========

public static Test suite() {
TestSuite suite = new TestSuite(THIS_CLASS);

TestSetup setup = new BoamMoTestSetup(suite) {
/** Builds the mo tree. */
public void build_the_tree() throws Exception {
Control tx = TransactionServiceImpl.instance()

.getTransactionFactory()
.create(5000);
Coordinator context = tx.getCoordinator();

mockSectorMoImpl =
MockSector.create(ManagedElementMoImpl
.instance(), null,
"id",
null, context);

//MockObjects for testConfigWith1Carrier() and
testConfigWith2Carrier().
ManagedObject mockDpclDeviceMoImpl = new
MockDpclDeviceMoImpl(mockSectorMoImpl,

"1",

context);
ManagedObject mockTpaDeviceMoImpl = new
MockTpaDeviceMoImpl(mockSectorMoImpl,

"1",

context);
ManagedObject mockDbccDeviceMoImpl = new
MockDbccDeviceMoImpl(mockSectorMoImpl,

"1",

context);
ManagedObject mockTrDeviceMoImpl = new
MockTrDeviceMoImpl(mockSectorMoImpl,

"1",

context);

mockAiDeviceMoFront1 = new
MockAiDeviceMoFront(mockSectorMoImpl,

AiDeviceMo.TYPE_NAME,
"1",
context);
mockAiDeviceMoFront1.setResourceId(context,
aiDevfroId1);
mockAiDeviceMoFront2 = new
MockAiDeviceMoFront(mockSectorMoImpl,

AiDeviceMo.TYPE_NAME,
"2",
context);
mockAiDeviceMoFront2.setResourceId(context,
aiDevfroId2);

mockAiDeviceMoFront3 = new
MockAiDeviceMoFront(mockSectorMoImpl,

AiDeviceMo.TYPE_NAME,
"3",
context);
mockAiDeviceMoFront3.setResourceId(context,
aiDevfroId3);

mockAiDeviceMoFront4 = new
MockAiDeviceMoFront(mockSectorMoImpl,

AiDeviceMo.TYPE_NAME,
"4",
context);
mockAiDeviceMoFront4.setResourceId(context,
aiDevfroId4);

LrsCreateCellCarrierRspS lrsCreateCellCarrierRspS = new
LrsCreateCellCarrierRspS();

lrsCreateCellCarrierRspS.cellCarrierFroId = ccFroid1;
lrsCreateCellCarrierRspS.clientId = CarrierMo.CLIENT_ID;
lrsCreateCellCarrierRspS.errorCode = 0;
lrsCreateCellCarrierRspS.result = RbsTypes.RBS_OK;
lrsCreateCellCarrierRspS.frequencyPlane = 100;

SignalHandlerRepository.instance()

.lookup(LrsCreateCellCarrierReqS.class)

.setResponsSig(lrsCreateCellCarrierRspS);

signalInitForCarrierConfigTest(0, 1, ccFroid1, 0,
aiDevfroId1,
0, 0, 0);

//create at least an attribute
AttrListImpl attr = new AttrListImpl(2);

attr.addElement(CarrierMo.USER_LABEL,
new String(CarrierMo.USER_LABEL));

// and create mandatory attr also
attr.addElement(CarrierMo.FREQUENCY_PLANE,
new
Integer(CarrierMo.FREQUENCY_PLANE_MIN_VALUE));

carrierMoImpl = (CarrierMoImpl)
CarrierMoImpl.create(mockSectorMoImpl,

CarrierMo.TYPE_NAME,

"T1",

context,

attr,

null);

BchMoImpl bchMoImpl = (BchMoImpl)
BchMoImpl.create(carrierMoImpl,
1, 2,

BchMo.TYPE_NAME,

"id");

// wait for 1 second
Thread.sleep(1000);

tx.getTerminator().commit();
} //end build_the_tree

/** Removes the mo tree. */
public void delete_the_tree() throws Exception {
carrierMoImpl = null;
carrierMoImpl2 = null;
} //end delete_the_tree
};
return setup;
}

NPE is thrown on this line ( see above code).
tx.getTerminator().commit();

Here is the NPE stack trace:

java.lang.NullPointerException
at
se.ericsson.wcdma.rbs.boam.pms.impl.CounterScanner.registerToAgent(Count\
erScanner.java:289)
at
se.ericsson.wcdma.rbs.boam.pms.impl.CounterScanner.initiate(CounterScann\
er.java:250)
at
se.ericsson.wcdma.rbs.boam.pms.impl.CounterScanner.<init>(CounterS\
canner.java:113)
at
se.ericsson.wcdma.rbs.boam.pms.impl.MoScanner.commitCreate(MoScanner.jav\
a:157)
at
se.ericsson.wcdma.rbs.boam.pms.impl.MoScanner.access$000(MoScanner.java:\
60)
at
se.ericsson.wcdma.rbs.boam.pms.impl.MoScanner$PmsResource.commit(MoScann\
er.java:366)
at
se.ericsson.cello.transaction.ControlImpl.commit(ControlImpl.java:152)
at
se.ericsson.wcdma.rbs.boam.mao.rmo.cell.tb.sut.CarrierMoImplTest$1.build\
_the_tree(CarrierMoImplTest.java:244)
at
se.ericsson.wcdma.rbs.boam.common.tb.util.BoamMoTestCase$BoamMoTestSetup\
.setUp(BoamMoTestCase.java:148)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup$1.protect(TestSetup.java:18)
at junit.framework.TestResult.runProtected(TestResult.java:124)
at junit.extensions.TestSetup.run(TestSetup.java:23)
at
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.run(JUnitTe\
stRunner.java:289)
at
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.launch(JUni\
tTestRunner.java:656)
at
org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.optional.junit.JUnitTestRunner.main(JUnitT\
estRunner.java:537)

Cheers,

//Mikael

>
> Lasse
